title: Pre-Upgrade: Shutting Down Workflows and Desktops - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
text: Before upgrading the Platform, all workflow groups, workflows, and connected Desktops must be properly shut down, except: Workflows running on standalone ECs Shut Down Workflow Groups, Workflows, and Desktops Disable all Workflow Groups and Workflows Disable all workflow groups and workflows to prevent automatic startup by the scheduler. Use the Execution Manager in Desktop (see Execution Manager for details) to disable all workflow groups and workflows. Or run the following MZSH command: # Disable all the workflow groups mzsh mzadmin/<password> wfgroupdisable * # Disable all the workflows mzsh mzadmin/<password> wfdisable <full workflow name> example, disable all the workflows under a folder mzsh mzadmin/<password> wfdisable ZZ_SVC1234.* Stop all Workflow Groups and Workflows Use the Execution Manager in Desktop (see Execution Manager for details) to stop workflow group and workflows. Or run the following MZSH command: # Stop all the workflow groups mzsh mzadmin/<password> wfgroupstop <workflow group name> # Stop all the workflows mzsh mzadmin/<password> wfstop <full workflow name> example, stop all the workflows under a folder mzsh mzadmin/<password> wfstop ZZ_SVC1234.* Shut down all connected Desktops Instruct all users to close their Desktops before proceeding with the upgrade. To check which Desktops are currently connected, run the following MZSH command: mzsh mzadmin/<password> desktopadmin -l To shutdown the Desktop, run the following MZSH command: mzsh mzadmin/<password> desktopadmin -x 1 "Shutting down for Platform upgrade"
